messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
3124 North Truewood, number B.
What's the emergency?
There's a gunshot wound to the chest.
Number B?
Yes.
Okay, help is on the way. How old is the victim?
He's a 30-year-old male. Shot to the left side in the chest. There's bubbles coming out of his nose.
It sounds like a sucking chest wound. Do you know if this was accidental or intentional?
I think it was an accident.
Alright, stay calm. Help is on the way. What's the victim's name?
His name is Justin Thomas.
Roll his head to the side to see if you can get the blood out of his mouth. Is he breathing?
He's breathing, but there are bubbles coming out of his mouth occasionally. It's not regular.
Is anyone else there with you?
Yes, I have two other people here. We're trying to do first aid.
Was anyone else with him when the accident happened?
No, it seems like it was an accident involving his son. He came over to get some stuff. I was in bed, but a buddy of mine was with him.
How old is his son?
The child's about three or four.
Was a pistol involved?
Yes, it was a .380 caliber pistol on the countertop.
Where is the gun now?
I moved it. I'm going to unload it so it's safe.
Okay, go ahead and secure the weapon. Let me know when it's done.
All done. The weapon is secure, and a round is missing, I think.
Alright. What's your name, sir?
My name is James.
James, are you in the room with Justin right now?
Yes.
Is he responsive?
No, he's not responsive. He's breathing, but not regularly. There are bubbles coming out of his mouth.
I need you to lay him flat on his back. Is there anything under his head?
No, nothing under his head. He's flat on his back.
Good. Pull his chin up slightly to make sure his airway is clear. Let me know when that's done.
Okay, his chin is up and airway clear.
We're going to start CPR. Are you ready?
Yes, I'm ready.
Place the heel of your hand on his breastbone, right between the nipples. Place your other hand on top of that. Are you in position?
Yes, I'm ready.
Pump hard and fast, 30 times, about twice per second. Let the chest come all the way up between pumps. Count out loud for me.
Okay, doing it now. One, two, three... eighteen... Twenty-nine, thirty.
Check his mouth and let me know if there's anything other than blood.
There's something thicker and darker than blood.
Alright. Tilt his head back, pinch his nose closed, and give him two regular breaths. You can skip this if you're uncomfortable.
Okay, I tried.
James, can you hear me? We're going back to compressions. Continue until help arrives.
Alright, continuing CPR.
Is someone else there to assist?
The firefighters just arrived.
Okay, I'll let them take over. You're doing great. Thank you, James.
